name: The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the hotel several times. It is with quiet nice, courteous staff, and clean rooms.
reviews.title: Great hotel away from the crowd

likes.liked: — it is far away from the insanity of Waikiki
likes.disliked: — in being in a quiet location, one must walk, drive or take taxi to dinner lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant on the ground level facing the beach is a bit overpriced, especially for dinner ; the service staff can be a bit surly . There is a sushi restaurant at the hotel which we have never tried. There are some amazing ( and not touristy ) restaurants a short cab ride away on Kapahulu Ave. that offer a variety of reasonable ethnic cuisine.
reviews.title: The best hotel for a romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms can be a bit small but suggest ocean view only since the other rooms face high rises and this defeats the purpose of being in a tropical setting.
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem

likes.liked: — The quiet location and the beach
likes.disliked: — The small room and the noisy air conditioner above the bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the most amazing time at the New Otani. I never ever wrote a hotel review in my life although me and my husband have travelled a lot and usually stay in 4 and 5 star hotels around the world. But after our trip to the New Otani I decided I had to. I chose the hotel because of a recommendation from a friend who raved about how secluded and beautiful it was although being in Honolulu. And she was right. At our arrival we were welcomed by the incredibly nice staff who even got us an upgrade for our room. The ocean view room (716) was just amazing, overlooking the sea, the secluded Sans Souci beach right in front of the hotel, Honolulu skyline and Kapiolani Park. If you stay here, get an ocean view room, it's worth it! Having breakfast and dinner (fantastic restaurant by the way!) on the lanai right at the beach without the feel of a huge resort or hotel complex - it couldn't get any better. If you like big resorts and pool areas this isn't for you. But if you want to experience this very private feel with an outstanding service, then come here. The waiters all looked like they really love their job. Isn't that what you wish for when you go out dining on your vacation - except the great food? Well, you figured it out, we enjoyed our stay there. When our flight was delayed, they even offered us a room to freshen up and stay in at no cost until we had to head to the airport at night.
reviews.title: Good hotel with great location
"A dream come true" for Patricia and Geoff.Norwich England
reviews.text: Great hotel and only a 7 minute walk to Honolulu center. Definitely more than a 3-star hotel!!! Thanks to the staff for making this vacation an unforgettable one!

reviews.title: Quiet retreat in Honolulu
reviews.text: We spent five nights at the New Otani in Honolulu and were very pleased with the facilities and service. The location is a 10 minute walk from the rest of Waikiki, through a beautiful park along the coast. The hotel has its own private beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was small but comfortable with a mini refrigerator, robes, all toiletries, plenty of towels, a seating area and a balcony. The hotel website is very clear about the locations and views and prices of the rooms. We paid a little more for Diamond Head view and enjoyed that; the ocean view rooms are more. You can look at their site and pick exactly what you want. The room was clean and well maintained.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful at all times. The concierge helped us with sightseeing.
reviews.title: Hawaii never again !!!

likes.disliked: — Wasting 4 of my 7 days fixing a problem caused by hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel itself has an excellent Japanese restaurant, and a pleasant restaurant right on the beach, with regional cuisine and fresh ingrediants. We had several breakfasts, several lunches and a dinner there and were pleased with the food, the service and the view. There are also restaurants in a couple of nearby hotels if you don't feel like going into Waikiki.
reviews.title: Great Choice for Independents and Families with Small Children

likes.liked: — Quiet, on the beach, stunning views and friendly service
likes.disliked: — Room getting dated, difficult to keep cool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel for anyone who wants to experience the beauty of Honolulu without the crowds and noise.
reviews.title: a piece of paradise, kinda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel was perfect for our trip. Far enough from the crowds to be quiet, but close enough to restaurants and my meeting to be convenient. Staff was extremely courteous, rooms were clean (although small as others have observed), view of the park and ocean was great. Very relaxing, very reasonable.
reviews.title: It's a keeper!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005, traveled on business
reviews.text: I was worried about staying here after reading some of the reviews here but I had a great stay here. It is at the very Diamond Head end of Waikiki, but it is really only a short walk into town. If you are going to the way other end of Waikiki it is a long walk, my freinds were staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village so to meet them there was somewhat difficult, but it was easy to get to Central Waikiki. I had a room with 2 twin beds to myself. The room was smaller than the Hilton, but it really was enough, I was barely in the room ever. The beach in front of the hotel is also very nice. It's blocked off from the main beach by some sort of run down war memorial so for part of the walk to town, you can't walk along the beach.
reviews.title: Great hotel, no complaints at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005
reviews.text: Another review said there were bugs in the room but I didn't see any. Someone also complained about the A/C, it is a modern unit with digital temperature controls I was quite comfortable even with it right over the bed. Since it is a smaller hotel, service is much more personal. Also the restaurant is excellent. I had a four course prix fixe meal which was the best I had my whole trip.
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005
reviews.text: This hotel is a hidden gem in the overcrowded and overpriced area of Waikiki. We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. It is a smaller hotel that has great service, a great location (for us), and a beautiful beach. My husband and I are in our mid-30s without kids. We wanted to visit Waikiki, but we also wanted to try and minimize the amount of screaming children we saw as well. The location, the size, and the price of this hotel were the main reasons we chose it.
reviews.title: Best Snorkeling in Waikiki!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have been staying in this hotel regularly since 1990. We find it wonderfully relaxing particularly if you are staying in a room at least on the seventh floor facing the ocean. The swaying coconut palms that are just below you are amazingly hypnotic. This is the only hotel that I know that I can spend hours on the balcony with a book ; totally at ease.
reviews.title: Wonderfully relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are a little small but with the beach immediately adjacent and the park also adjacent it is easy to go for a peaceful stroll so if like me you quickly go ' stir crazy ' it will not happen here.
reviews.title: A gem near Diamond Head

likes.liked: — Not at the beach but ON the beach. Serene location.
likes.disliked: — A little plain, but the spectacular murals (the floor-to-ceiling windows) conpensate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a small store just at the front of the hotel to buy sandwiches and beer and wine so it is entirely possible to have an al-fresco picnic in the park, or on the beach, or on your balcony. If you take alcohol onto the beach be careful as in June within seven days we saw three Police patrols looking for drugs/alcohol ? I personally find that reassuring - just be careful.
reviews.title: Perfect Price - Perfect Location

likes.liked: — The bed and the way its dressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff are friendly and helpful and many have been there for years !
reviews.title: Be Picky about the room they give you!

likes.liked: — Proxminaty to the beach and park and the quieter atmosphere
likes.disliked: — Poor quest amenities, poor view for price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant overlooking the beach and at its level is lovely.
reviews.title: Lovely Wedding and Stay at the New Otani Kaimana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: I love the Kaimana Beach Hotel. I first discovered it when the old Halekulani was torn down to make room for the new Halekulani. It was the perfect transition between the old Hawaiiana of the Halekulani and the modern resort the Halekulani became. The Kaimana is one of the most delighful hotels in Waikiki and a relative bargin too.
reviews.title: A Gem in Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I actually think the Kaimana has a better location than the Halekulani. It sits on San Souci beach near the Outrigger Canoe Club and on Kapiolani Park. It is much quieter than the heart of Waikiki, yet walking distance of it all.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: When the Halekulani is booked, this is one of my main back-ups, the Moana being my other top choice.
reviews.title: Quiet Time at the Beach

likes.liked: — location near beach and Kapiolani Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even when I DO get into the Halekulani I still come down to the Kaimana for at least one meal, and sometimes more, at the Hau Tree Lanai. It is one of the most pleasant eating spots in all of Hawaii.
reviews.title: Great Place. Close to it all, yet far enough away.

likes.disliked: — One of the valets was rude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be forwarned, the regular rooms are TINY, but the rates are so reasonable you can get a junior suite for the cost of a deluxe room at most other properties.
reviews.title: Don't believe the complainers - New Otani is terrific!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel due to the reviews here on trip advisor. Excellent location away from the hustle and busle of downtown wakai. Excellent beach outside the hotel with good snorkelling. Shop close by for snacks etc. Would recomend paying that little extra for a room with a view as we had the view of the next hotel (but hey you don't come to Hawaii to sit in the room). An awesome time.
reviews.title: Excellent Quiet Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We moved to the New Otani after starting at another hotel (Aqua Bamboo) that just didn't live up to our expectations.
reviews.title: Unbelieveable Setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was on my morning walk on the second day of our trip when I happened across the New Otani. It was a little ways from where we were staying, but it is in a very quiet end of Waikiki essentially in a park, on the beach. I went in and inquired about rates and I was very surprised that they were not much more than the place we were in three blocks from the beach.
reviews.title: good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I walked back to my hotel, got my wife and walked back to have breakfast at the New Otani. She loved the place instantly, so while she was having breakfast I "went to the men's room". I really went to the front desk and asked if they had any rooms open for the next four days. They did, I actually had a couple of choices and I chose an Ocean View Deluxe room for little more than I was was paying to not really see the ocean.
reviews.title: Peaceful and quiet with awesome views

likes.disliked: — Homeless people and crazies in next door park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't tell my wife anything until after we got back to the other hotel after lunch. I started packing my bags. When she asked what I was doing, I told I had had it with where we were! She thought I was nuts.... well I can't carry off jokes very well so I told her I had booked at the New Otani. Her bag flew out of the closet as SHE packed to get over to the New Otani.
reviews.title: Nice but can be decieving

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel rooms are much too small. There was only about two feet of space when you walked into the room. There was no room to put suitcases. We cleared off the space above the TV for my husbands and put mine on the floor under the TV. I don't think I'd ever stayed in a room so small.
reviews.title: Okay Hotel
Great Location
reviews.text: The A/C either makes the room too hot or too cold. We were constantly making adjustments (even in the middle of the night). The air also seemed to blow directly down. We couldn't find a way to adjust it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the bar prices to be a bit high. We had a Mai Tai at Duke's for $7, and they were $9 at the hotel bar, and it was made with lesser quality ingredients (in my opinion). The restaurant prices seemed high, so we never ate there, so I can't give a review on that.
reviews.title: Wouldn't stay there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was almost a private beach for the hotel. It was quiet and peaceful. (Compared to Waikiki) The hotel lent us mats and towels to use. This was very nice.
reviews.title: Should be demolished
A B&B So Cute abd different..Kaimana's Beach Hale
reviews.text: The bellman is also the valet, towel lender, direction-giver, luggage checker, etc. They need another person to assist with this job. We had to wait frequently, because we couldn't find the bellman, because he was outside somewhere or giving directions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Kaimana Beach Hotel is situated in the shadow of Diamond Head on Sans Souci Beach, and across from Kapi'olani Park. Incidentally, Kaimana is Hawaiian for diamond, and this hotel is definitely a gem. Built in the late-1940's on the site of the former McInerny Cottage, which was a tasteful Victorian design with an ocean lanai and wood railing under a distinctive hau tree whose shade was enjoyed by Robert Louis Stevenson.
reviews.title: A diamond of a hotel!

likes.disliked: — That's a real stretch, but no Jacuzzi.

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: The distinguished tree and wood railing have been integrated into today's Kaimana's dining treasure "The Hau Tree Lanai," an ideal venue for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. It's the most relaxing oceanfront restaurant in Honolulu. Renovated in the mid-60's, when the nine story tower was added, it has a retro look on the exterior, but an open, breezy lobby which imparts a tropical feel. No pool, but Sans Souci is a great beach, replete with local eye candy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Kaimana was acquired by the vaunted New Otani chain of Japan, which has thus far wisely kept the Hawaiian ambiance that insures it remains a standard amongst locals, both the native-born and kama'aina, for dining and receptions. For instance when returning from a morning jog around Kapi'olani Park under the port a chere I bumped into a law school schoolmate who was then serving as Lieutenant Governor.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Close to the Honolulu Zoo, away from the hustle and bustle of mainstream tourist strip, and located past the Aquarium and the World War I Memorial Natatorium, the Kaimana brackets the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. It's a short, but picturesque drive from the shops, cinemas, and restaurants of Kahala Mall.
reviews.title: Beautiful Tranquil Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is probably why the property imparts a club-like, but casual, air of exclusivity. New Otani has avoided the mistake of overdeveloping their site. While hardly bargain priced, its prices provide better value than Honolulu's two grande dames further up Kalakaua Avenue.
reviews.title: Great, small and quiet hotel

likes.disliked: — $11.50 for internet access for 24hrs. No fitness facility for free.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: The New Otani is near Diamond Head, and well removed from the hectic Waikiki Beach area. It is a bit isolated from other restaurants and shops, but it is right on a beautiful beach with great views of the ocean and Diamond Head. It has a great beachfront restaurant and lounge. The room was small but very clean and comfortable, good bedding with duvet cover. It was a nice romantic spot, and we were sorry we could only spend one night there on our way back to the mainland.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location

likes.disliked: — far from restaurants and shops, a little bit over budget. (meals in hotel)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the New Otani for a week in April. We made reservations by phone and got the internet discount as well as a week discount. We were in a Diamond Head room on the 6th floor – with a beautiful view of Diamond Head and Kapiolani park.
reviews.title: Great location and wonderful hotel
Quiet but close to all that Waikiki offers
reviews.text: The room was small but clean and attractively decorated in blues and greens. It had a small fridge as well as a couple of chairs and small table both in the room and also on the lanai.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With the exception of a little noise from the street on Friday night, the hotel was very quiet. The hotel sits on the Sans Souci beach which is a perfect swimming beach. You can get beach towels, mats, and chairs from the front desk.
reviews.title: Nice quiet location

likes.liked: — Location, it is not in the center of Waikiki
likes.disliked: — It was a little bit of walk to restaurants and stores

reviews.title: Great Value, Wonderful Quiet Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: There are lots of food options within 2 miles (we walked because it is such a pleasant walk along the beach or through the park although parts of the park can be a little isolated late at night). All the following are nearby: Leonard’s Bakery (for malasadas), Diamond Head Market (great take-out for breakfast, lunch, or dinner especially the grilled veggies), Rainbow Drive-In, Ono Hawaiian Foods (great chicken laulau), and of course all the restaurants in Waikiki (including the Hula Grill for breakfast). We also ate breakfast at the Hau Tree Lanai a couple of times and it is very scenic.

description: Take advantage of its paradisiacal setting, The New Otani Kaimana Beach Hotel is a refreshing escape from the crowds of Waikiki. This boutique hotel sits right on one of Honolulu’s best white-sand beach, cradled next to the slopes of Diamond Head Crater, and located directly across from the 108 acre Kapiolani Park, perfect for those seeking a recreational or romantic.
